item.title: Humpty Dumpty
item.description: Humpty Dumpty learned caution and care He climbed down the wall. And grew fat in a chair!

item.title: Fat cat
item.description: Once there was a cat who wouldn’t catch a rat. Yet it grew fat by sleeping on the mat. How’s that!

item.title: I have no gun but I can spit
item.description: Some twelve inches below my lips The Human of my Person lives. It melts for strangers with meaningless smile. And indifferent to most other kind. Beware, O Stranger! Rudely crossing it. I have no gun, but I can spit. (Inspired by a poem “I have not gun but I can spit” by W H Auden).

item.title: In the classroom
item.description: In the classroom, I glance at the blackboard It inspires; and murmurs What is already known. In the classroom; Inspired! I gaze outside the window. And wonder, What may be unknown.
